_comment: Created by EFisher on 25/02/2014 18:20:20 using v2.0
title: What are the views of inpatients on whether they were treated with dignity and respect?
analysis_commentary: Responses to this question in the survey have been remarkably consistent since 2005. In 2012, four out of every five inpatients surveyed felt they were treated with dignity and respect during their stay in hospital. The most recent survey shows a statistically significant increase from 79% in the 2011 survey. The percentage of inpatients who felt they were not treated with dignity and respect during their hospital stay has remained constant at 3% since 2005.
data_source: Care Quality Commission, Survey of Adult Inpatients and Survey of Outpatients
